column1: 18:32|As he stepped out of the great Gothic cathedral it started to rain. Septimus reluctantly undid his neatly rolled umbrella and
column4: hoping he would be in time to catch the 6:32.|Broken Routine|Jeffrey Archer

column1: 18:32|She didn’t emerge again until 6:32 p.m. She was dressed in her civilian clothes
column2: and headed in the direction of Summers’s flat
column3: stopping on the way to pick up one of his suits from the dry cleaner’s. At 6:58 she let herself into the house.|Turn a Blind Eye|Jeffrey Archer

column1:
18:32|Monday 6:32 P.M.
Tanzan Mino was dressed in a black three-quarter sleeved kimono
column2: staring straight ahead as he knelt before the sword resting in front of him. His hands were settled lightly on his thighs
column3: his face expressionless. Then he reached out and touched the scabbard
column4: bowing low to it. Inside was a twelfth-century katana
column5: a five-foot-long razor created by swordsmiths of the Mino School
column7: near Gifu in the heart of old Honshu. It was
column9: a perfect metaphor for Japanese excellence and discipline.|Project Daedalus|Thomas Hoover
